answers.answer: If you follow the diet in "what to expect when you are expecting" you will gain almost nothing.

I'm 23w3d and have gained 7-8lbs, I'm chunkier, and my doctor told me that my weight gain was fine so far. I'm sure there's more pressure on your weight because of the gestational diabetes, just do what you can, eat healthy, and exercise when you can, and you're doing all you can, you'll have a healthy baby! A lot of women get gestational diabetes, and don't develop diabetes after, so I wouldn't stress over it! My OB with my son made me feel terrible about my weight gain, some doctors stress it more than others!
Thank u trying not to stress to much about it

I was a size 18 before I got pregnant Im 5'8" and I've gained 8 pounds so far I'm 28 weeks and 3 days I really hope I only gain maybe 10 more pounds if that ... My doctor hasn't said anything about my weight ... I did lose 11 pounds from morning sickness.. I took my diabetes test 2 weeks ago and haven't heard anything but I go to the doctor Thursday evening

I am the same size as u I've only gained like 4 lbs but I never gained with my first either so I wouldn't worry much. The diabetes is most likely the reason u have gained. I am 24weeks I lost the first two months then gained the last few pounds in the past 2 months. Don't worry just eat healthy.
i was an 18 before, i gained about 18 lbs FAAAST. but i haven't gained any since. actually lost since i went 2 weeks ago. my doctor has never said anything to me about it though.

I started at a 20 also.  I got maternity pants at like 8 weeks because I was already squeezing out of my regular clothes and didn't think it made much sense to get more regular.  I lost 12 lbs from morning sickness and switching to a healthier diet and have gained 4 lbs.  It seems like I'm able to ingest more calories than I used to be able to and not gain weight which is weird for me.  I'm already taking Metformin for PCOS and my obgyn said he would have put me on it anyway since I have a family hx of diabetes.  I passed my 3 hr test and will have to do another in a month or two so hopefully I pass that one, too.  It's nice to know I'm not alone.  I def don't care about stretch marks or "getting my body back" as it wasn't that great to begin with lol.  I will try to get the weight off again after the baby is born once and for all.

I researched before I was able to see my obgyn. I was size 18 before I got pregnant, Everything I read said its healthy to gain a little but not as much as a smaller women. My obgyn hasnt said anything negative about my weight gain as ling as I eat healthy foods, take my vitamins, and drink all my water. I am 26+4 and have gained 25 lbs. But my bp is perfect and I havent had a past of diabetes or probs with my bloodsugar.. I  have my diabetes test coming up tho so we will see. But I think as long as u eat healthy, vitamins, water and walk that you and baby should be ok.

I know how you feel as I was a size 18/20 when I got pregnant with my daughter April 2011. I gained close to 30lbs with her when my doctor told me 10-15lb gain. Where with my first son I gained 21lbs and my second I gained 10lbs. I say don't stress it and just try to eat as healthy as you can.

question: I started at size 20 when i got pregnant and now im 22 weeks 3 days im so scared im going to gain a lot more weight i have already gained 10lbs doctor didnt want me to gain any i also have gestational diabetes and I hope I don't have regular diabetes when I'm done being pregnant anyone else have issues like this I really hope to have a healthy baby
title: plus size and pregnant
